analysis.narrative:
ðŸ“Š **Consensus:** Market sentiment is MIXED with medium conviction. Twitter sentiment is decidedly bullish (77%), but RSS News and YouTube analysts show more cautious positioning (55% and 50% bullish respectively), while the professional trader data reveals significant bearish skew (13% bullish). This divergence suggests retail/social media optimism is not matched by institutional conviction or professional trader positioning.

ðŸ“ˆ **Themes:** (1) Mega-cap tech and AI infrastructure momentum narrative persists, but technical exhaustion warnings in mid-caps and growth assets suggest momentum may be fragile; (2) Year-end liquidity concerns and options expiry dynamics creating near-term headwinds despite positive macro narratives; (3) Corporate earnings execution lagging forward-looking bull caseâ€”guidance cuts in large-cap software and financial services represent concrete downside pressure against optimistic sentiment.

ðŸŽ¯ **Levels:** SPY ($690.17): Call Wall $700 (146k OIâ€”active hedging at 1.4% away), Put Wall $640 (153k OIâ€”dormant at 7.3% away). Max Pain $687. Near resistance: $730 (48k OI, dormant), $750 (55k OI, dormant). Near support: $670 (45k OI, active), $645 (126k OI, dormant). QQQ ($624.53): Call Wall $630 (33k OIâ€”active at 0.9% away), Put Wall $590 (164k OIâ€”dormant at 5.5% away). Max Pain $620. Near resistance: $640 (31k OI, active), $625 (29k OI, active). Near support: $585 (137k OI, dormant). Per Twitter: /ES levels around 6940â€“7000 breakout zone mentioned as bullish target if 6900 holds. NVDA sustained action above $190 cited as sector health indicator.
key_themes: Mega-cap tech momentum vs. mid-cap deterioration
Year-end liquidity and options expiry pressure
Corporate earnings execution lag vs. bullish sentiment
risk_factors: Professional trader bearish skew (87% bearish) contradicts retail bullish consensusâ€”potential reversal trigger if professionals are correct
Mid-cap weakness ($IWM) and Bitcoin deterioration (-7% YTD) signal divergence from mega-cap strength; breadth failure often precedes broader pullbacks
Options hedging flows and December expirations creating artificial support/resistance zones; liquidity dries up into year-end, amplifying moves
Earnings guidance cuts in software and financial services (Fiserv, Workday cited) represent concrete downside pressureâ€”'show me' evidence on profitability becoming critical
Geopolitical escalation (Ukraine, Taiwan) and regulatory tightening on banks pose tail-risk catalysts for rapid risk-off rotation
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: Resistance at $700 (active call wall with 146k OIâ€”dealer hedging likely to pressure upside). Support at $670 (active with 45k OI). QQQ: Resistance at $630 (active call wall, 33k OI) and $625 (active, 29k OI). Support at $590. Watch for consolidation between call/put walls; professional trader bearishness suggests selling into strength toward $700 SPY / $630 QQQ resistance.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: Range-bound bias between $700 (call wall resistance) and $670 (active support). If $670 breaks, $645 (126k OI put wall) becomes the downside target. Downside scenario favored by RSS News and professional trader data. QQQ: Similar structureâ€”$630 call wall capped upside; $590 put wall (164k OI) provides downside protection but only if price declines >5.5%. Swing traders should favor selling rallies into call walls and watching for breakdown below $670 SPY / $590 QQQ as confirmation of bearish thesis.

regime.label: NEUTRAL
regime.summary: Market is lacking clear direction. Wait for confirmation.

action.summary: NEUTRAL: No clear edge. Cash is a position.
